title: Calories in Chili with Beans
meta_description: Discover calories in chili with beans per cup serving, including macros like protein, carbs, fat, and nutrition tweaks for your meal.
assumptions: Canned beef chili with beans, standard variety; includes ground beef, kidney beans, tomatoes, onions, spices; no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, meat type, bean variety, and preparation; homemade or fresh versions may differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of chili with beans has about 286 kcal, 15 g protein, and 30 g carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of chili with beans?
faqs.a: Approximately 286 kcal for a standard beef chili with beans.

faqs.q: Is chili with beans high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 15 g protein per cup, mainly from beef and beans.

faqs.q: What's the sodium content in chili with beans?
faqs.a: Around 1020 mg per cup; opt for low-sodium versions if watching intake.

faqs.q: Does homemade chili with beans have fewer calories?
faqs.a: It can, depending on ingredientsâ€”lean meat and less oil reduce calories vs. canned.

faqs.q: How much fiber in chili with beans?
faqs.a: About 11 g per cup, thanks to the beans and vegetables.
